posts.content:
Did you know that the speed at which your website loads can significantly impact your Google search rankings? Google has confirmed that page speed is a ranking factor, as it directly affects user experience.

Moreover, studies have shown that faster-loading pages tend to rank higher in search results.

Optimizing your websiteâ€™s load time not only enhances user satisfaction but also boosts your visibility online.

Are you currently prioritizing this?
posts.commentAdded: Great reminder! Page speed is crucial for both user experience and SEO. Time to prioritize those optimizations for better visibility! ðŸš€

posts.name:
Dan Goodman
Dan Goodman
posts.content:
Hispanic SDR placed on PIP and terminated with no severance weeks after filing for paternity leave with the company and with the state he lives in. 

I worked with a young SDR named Miguel, who is the sole provider for his family of four, including two children under the age of three.

Up until he requested leave, there were no complaints or concerns about performance.  Despite tracking to 70% of his goal, while several of his white colleagues were at just 20% and were not on a PIP or terminated, Miguel was terminated just 6 days prior to his scheduled paternity leave.

Miguel experienced differing treatment throughout his tenure, feeling it was driven by discriminatory factors and blatant favoritism.

Miguel lives in one of the 12 states in the U.S. that have state-based paid FMLA leave. His leave was approved by the state and sent to his employer who denied ever receiving it as a defense for Miguelâ€™s wrongful termination.

Despite Miguelâ€™s low salary and unlikeness of a lucrative outcome, I was happy to help him. It angers me to hear when people are taken advantage of and mistreated like this.

Miguel did an incredible job with our assistance putting together a reputationally damaging and shameful document and forwarded it on to the HR person who terminated him.

The response back was a big beat it and not a very respectful way. We escalated to the head of HR and were ignored. Next, we escalated to the CEO who requested a call with Miguel.

We prepared Miguel for the call, and he did a great job. The CEO expressed his empathy for Miguelâ€™s situation and agreed to offer one monthâ€™s severance and healthcare.

While the gesture was appreciated, it was most definitely not enough. If Miguel had not been wrongly terminated, he would have been eligible for 12 weeksâ€™ paid leave.

We went back two more times to the CEO, who eventually agreed to 3 monthsâ€™ severance and healthcare after being terminated with no severance.

The outcome to me was worth far more than any fee we received for our work. Knowing the impact that our work has in peopleâ€™s lives is the most rewarding work of my lifetime.

comments.commentText: Thanks for the repost Ed Karpinski. I appreciate it.
And if you were not around, what then? Incredible.
William Lutz, MPA, PMP he wouldâ€™ve walked away with nothing and looked back on this for years with anger and regret.
Dan Goodman Wish you were around back when I was going through my own hell.

posts.commentAdded: Incredible resilience shown by Miguel! Its crucial we stand up against unjust treatment in the workplace. His story is a powerful reminder of the need for fair practices.
